ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Creating and managing blogs, changelogs, and help documentation without requiring coding knowledge.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Launch a full-featured blog or help center in minutes â€¢ Prebuilt SEO-optimized and lightning-fast templates â€¢ Notion-like editor â€¢ Built-in newsletter support with Postmark integration â€¢ Custom domain support
ðŸ“– Summary: BlogBowl is an open-source, self-hosted blogging platform that allows users to quickly launch SEO-optimized blogs, product changelogs, and help documentation without coding. It features a Notion-like editor, built-in newsletter capabilities with Postmark integration, and support for custom domains.

ðŸš€ squirreldisk | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Analyzing disk space usage to identify and manage large files and folders.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Fast scan and deep directory scanning â€¢ Disk scanning or pick a directory â€¢ External disks real-time detection â€¢ Sunburst chart visualization â€¢ Drag and drop for deletion collection
ðŸ“– Summary: SquirrelDisk is a cross-platform desktop application built with Rust and React (Tauri) for analyzing disk usage. It quickly scans directories or entire disks to identify large files and folders, presenting the information through an intuitive sunburst chart and allowing users to manage files directly.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ nl2sql | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Converting natural language questions into SQL queries for database interaction.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Natural language to SQL conversion â€¢ Automatic database schema detection â€¢ Case-sensitive table name handling â€¢ Query validation before execution â€¢ Smart schema filtering based on context
ðŸ“– Summary: This Python project facilitates the conversion of natural language questions into executable SQL queries. It leverages OpenAI's language models and includes features for automatic database schema detection, query validation, and error handling to streamline data interaction.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ learning-roadmap | HTML
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To serve as a structured guide for individuals learning or advancing their skills in front-end development.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Curated learning roadmap for Front-End Developers â€¢ Covers essential web technologies (HTML, CSS, DOM, JavaScript) â€¢ References best-in-class and current tools and resources â€¢ Focuses on a terse, timely, and non-overwhelming curation â€¢ Intended for yearly content updates
ðŸ“– Summary: This repository provides a curated learning roadmap for aspiring and practicing Front-End Developers. It outlines essential web technologies, tools, and resources needed to learn and excel in front-end engineering, updated annually.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ unregistry | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Efficiently deploying Docker images to remote servers without the overhead of managing a container registry.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Push Docker images directly to remote servers over SSH â€¢ Transfers only missing image layers for efficiency â€¢ Eliminates the need for external or self-hosted registries â€¢ Acts as a lightweight, temporary registry on the remote server â€¢ Integrates with Docker CLI via a plugin
ðŸ“– Summary: Unregistry is a tool that allows users to push Docker images directly to remote servers over SSH without needing an external container registry. It efficiently transfers only the missing image layers, acting like an 'rsync' for Docker images.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source
